description:
Soberano ("Sovereign") is a card game that simulates a Renaissance court power struggle. The cards represent the characters, alliances, and powers. It's a fast-paced deck-building game with some twists.

•••

Soberano é um jogo de cartas que simula a disputa pelo poder em uma corte renascentista. As cartas representam os personagens, suas alianças e seus poderes.

Descrição    “O Rei está morto.”

Sem herdeiros aparentes e com todas as famílias nobres do reino alegando pretensão ao trono, o futuro parece incerto. Mas, de fato, apenas os Áquila e os Leone tem poder e influência para validar sua reivindicação e eles concordam em apenas uma coisa: preferem uma guerra a aceitar seus rivais no trono.

Você sabia disso. Você se preparou para isso. Infiltrou aliados leais a você nas duas famílias e agora chegou a hora de agir. Afinal, a coroa ficará melhor na sua cabeça.

“Vida longa ao Soberano.”

O Jogo
Em SOBERANO, você precisa usar sua astúcia e correr riscos para demonstrar força, enquanto a guerra civil entre as duas famílias mais poderosas assola o reino. Para isso, você vai manipular a corte e recrutar aliados nas duas famílias, trazendo esses personagens para trabalhar para você. Mas, não se iluda, a lealdade deles é temporária. Basta você pedir um favor ou fazer uma intriga e eles irão considerar qualquer influência que você tinha sobre eles paga. Controlar a burguesia, o clero e a nobreza é o seu maior objetivo e você realiza isso através de intrigas. Se você conseguir fazer isso antes que as outras famílias percebam quem é a ameaça, o seu plano pode funcionar e a coroa terminar sob a sua cabeça.

SOBERANO é um jogo de cartas para 2 a 4 jogadores disputando o direito ao trono. É um construtor de baralho, desconstruído, já que as cartas que você recruta para o seu baralho são temporárias. É também uma corrida por cinco pontos de vitória, representados pelas castas da sociedade (Burgueses, Clero e Nobres) associados as duas famílias principais. Aquele que conseguir os cinco pontos, provou para o reino que tem o que é preciso para ser chamado o SOBERANO.    Não Avaliado
Componentes    Componentes

32 Cartas de Aliados (4 conjuntos de 8 cartas - 1 a 4 - vermelhos e azuis)
24 Cartas da Corte (5 a 10 - vermelhos e azuis, duas cartas de cada cor)
10 Cartas de Locais (Burgueses, Clero e Nobres - vermelhos e azuis, uma carta de cada cor | Vila Inicial - quatro cartas, uma para cada jogador)
12 Cartas Melhorias (Laços e Cargos)

Wise Ask - A Trivia Game Where It Pays To Be A Know-It-All.

If you get invited to one more run-of-the-mill trivia game night, your know-it-all mind is going to blow a neuron.  Let that brilliant brain of yours really shine when you play Wise Ask.

Rather than answering one measly little question to earn a point like some trivia games, Wise Ask makes you answer five successive multiple-choice questions in your head and then shout a five-letter word made from the letters associated with each correct answer.  Shout out the right word, get a smart card.  Get it wrong, lose one.  Be first to collect five cards that spell S-M-A-R-T and win!

—description from the publisher

Tiny Ninjas: Heroes is a 1-2 player tactical combat game featuring grid-based movement, hand management, and variable abilities.

Players command a team of five ninjas with the goal of defeating their opponent’s Hero. Ninja characters are dynamic, each providing a unique strategic function.

Gameplay consists of players cycling through various phases: INCOME, MOVE, ACTION, ATTACK, DEFEND.

Players will acquire items, shields and Energy Points (EP) which are used to activate powerful abilities and string together extremely satisfying combos.

Custom printed ninja dice are used to track the positioning and health of each ninja. Battles take place within a 4x7 grid arena that is attached to the lid of the Game Box. The entire game can be played right within the Game Box.

The dedicated solo-mode, APOCALYPSE, pits a single player against endless waves of powerful and ruthless Zombies in a true fight for survival.

Tiny Ninjas: Heroes is quick to learn with layered tactical depth allowing for players to bond with specific Heroes and develop unique strategies.

The Last Chance to Save an Army

Operation Thunderclap is a simulation of the attempted German breakout of the Sixth Army which was surrounded in Stalingrad during mid-December 1942. The Sixth Army, Hitler’s largest force, is sent to capture Stalingrad. However, Stalin had prepared an effective snare; Circle around the city and keep the Sixth Army penned inside until their supplies ran out. To make matters worse, the Sixth Army was further prevented from leaving by Hitler’s own order: Remain in Stalingrad and await rescue. 
 Each of the players assumes one of the sides in this fateful encounter. The German player must attempt to defeat the Russian armies and penetrate the area known as the Stalingrad Pocket. The Russian player’s task is simple; hold the pocket long enough to rout the Sixth Army.

—description from the publisher

The "Let's Drink" coffee shop opens today!! Let's visit the host bunny and drink together! There's always special milk foam and ingredients for each cup of drink. Which one you want? Let's drink it!

When a player reveals a card from the drink deck in Let's Drink, everyone needs to distinguish the correct drink. There are many combinations of cup, taste, milk foam, and tablecloth. If you find the right one, you can get the card. If there's no appropriate drink, just remind the host bunny! Don't be too late to remind her, or you'll get nothing!

Monster-Bande contains 2 x 54 equal tiles with monster images. One set of tiles forms a face-down pile, the other one is spread out openly on the table. In addition, there are two dice. The faces of the dice show properties of monsters, such as horns, feet, color, numbers, etc.

Monster-Bande is played in teams of two or more players. One player on each team rolls the dice, then draws the top tile of the pile and has to describe the monster on it without saying any of the properties mentioned on the dice. The other players on the team have to identify the matching monster on the table. If successful, they take the tile and the active player draws a new one, etc., until the one-minute timer runs out. If the active player uses a forbidden word, the turn ends prematurely.

When all monsters have been assigned, the team with most tiles wins.

The game includes variants for younger players and for two or three players.

Fire Opal Games and Arc Dream Publishing bring you the grudge match to end them all: WRESTLENOMICON!

Become a Great Old One and slam, smash, and obliterate your opponent. Wrestlenomicon is a throw-down to the doom. This furious card game of squicky battles sets up in seconds and plays in minutes—or longer, if tactics are your thing. This is the definition of brainy beer-and-pretzels fun, with plenty of tentacles.

Each deck of cards represents a unique Great Old One. The core game includes a deck for CTHULHU—the Ageless Abomination! the South Seas Smasher!—and another for HASTUR, the insane and unspeakable force behind the King in Yellow. More Great Old Ones are coming.

Fast and fun dice bluffing game

It's tough out here in the old west but your gang of outlaws recently “discovered” a stash of gemstones. Must be your lucky day. Now all you've got to do is divide it up. Of course you want the bigger half, but the desert is too unforgiving to risk a gun fight. So you play a game of chance. That doesn’t mean you’ll play fair though...

Gem Hustle is dice game for 2 to 5 players. Roll the highest each round to claim gems, but you can only roll each dice once. With only a few high value dice, do you chance it on your own or team up with others but share the spoils?

Rounds are played until players have used all their dice or until there are no more gems left to be won. In a round players will;


     Stash - players take it in turns to add gems to the grey bag.
     Pick - players choose which dice they are going to roll.
     Hustle - players can chose to team up with other players and share the stash.
     Roll - players roll their dice. The players with the highest total claim the stash.


—description from the designer

40th Panzer Korps is a company/battalion level simulation of the battles in the vicinity of the old Napoleonic battle ground of Borodino just west of Mozhaysk. The players control the 40th Panzer Korps and elements of the Soviet’s 5th Army. The game uses the 48th Panzer Korps system, which emphasizes the special abilities of the various arms, armour, infantry and artillery.  The German player must use his powerful forces to open the road to Moscow and victory.

—description from the publisher

Board game version of the popular Danish TV children show "Ramasjang Mysteriet" where kids help Kristian solve crimes comitted by one of the usual suspects.

Help each other find out which of the 7 well known Ramasjang bad guys is guilty by finding evidence and investigate leads. As the game progress, try to guess who committed the crime. The winner is the who has accumulated most liquorice pipe (Danish candy) points at the end of the game.

—user summary

"Keep On Mr. Sergeant"

Service message:
Dear adults and kids,

This is an exciting game resulting many cheerful moments and much more mind-breaking minutes. First of all you will need some ingenuity and combination skills to be able to win.

The venue of the game is an imagined army base where several comic situations may occur. They are governed by 203 coloured cards decorated with artistic graphics. One of he aims of the game is to acquire the Secret Plan and forward it to the sergeant by the most creative way. Meanwhile we should be careful not to be seized to prison (however the prison works with half board service) or not to blurt any secrets in the pub in delirious state. We should decide tactically during our turn of duty whether we take risk or just take part in the barrack contest of „who knows better the canteen-keeper's woman.

But the surprise of the game is still left: the evolvement of  ’ant’, ’chameleon’, and ’hyena’… Those have the best chance to win who can conform to the constantly changing situation rather than choosing a permanent strategy. Any lags can be caught up with clever decisions. This is a real brain training. You can have several hours amusement by learning the duty service regulations.
Wish you many clever decisions, good luck and lots of fun,
                                the happy Sergeant

—description from the publisher (translated)

It is not the richest family, but you have to live something, so you want to manage it. To start your business, you have to have some animals, so you can compete with larger businesses.
The Székely Gazdálkodó tries to put you into situations that characterize the everyday life of the Székely people. Of course, there are some funny scenes that are just for fun. In Székely Gazdálkodó's board game, you can feel like a real host who is a master of your own farm and strives to get out of the ordinary people. We wish a good farming!

Schatten der Macht ("Shadows of Power") is a strategic Euro Boardgame in the Dark Eye universe.

Lead a clandestine Organisation into the battle for control of Aventuria. Gain influence in numerous locations on the continent (the game map), send out groups of heroic adventurers and command ships on the high seas.

Those who cleverly develop their influence on churches, magical societies and great lords will find themselves in a good position to assist their adventurers in the fight against competitors (and monsters) as well as convince the greatest heroes of the age to lend them their swords and wisdom. And last but not least, each secret organisation pursues its own agenda of intrigue in the Shadows of Power.

The main gameplay is focussed around gaining a deck of cards, each of them representing regions on the map or powerful characters and then playing those cards to use the resources they provide - to recruit and move adventures, influence organisations and command ships. A major aspect of the game revolves around combining actions to make them more powerful and resolve them without spending too many turns - since every player has the power to dictate the remaining duration of a round!

At the end of each round, conflicts regarding the control of regions are resolved - an elegant majority system is used to determine the victor, but since conflicts are not resolved during the individual player's turns, everyone can react and have a small skirmish become a decisive battle for victory.

In addition, the game features an innovative scoring mechanism that keeps the game free of bookkeeping hassles (all scoring is performed at the end) and also allows weaker players to catch up due to relative scoring systems.

The game features many illustrations on the cards - dozens of characters of Dark Eye lore, organisations and regions.

It is playable with 2-4 players as the basic game and there is a 5-6 player expansion available at launch.

—description from the publisher

You have two playing pieces who you want to move as fast you can thru the forest. It is always the playing piece that is furthest away from goal that have to move every time. At 10 spaces it will happen special things in the forest. The player that lands on these spaces have to roll a color-dice with only red and green fields and do the outcome of the die.

The wicked queen is back! Now she has taken away Snow White and holds her captive at the castle. You and your fellow players are the seven dwarfs, and now you have to leave the mine on a dangerous trip through the woods and into the castle's dark halls to free Snow White. Whoever can find Snow White has won the game!

An easy dice game where you move and do what the place you go to shows. In the castle you go to different rooms and look for Snow White. This is done by lifting a card. The one who finds Snow White first wins.

—user summary

In 2018, German publisher AMIGO released a special edition of the Bohnanza base game in a marketing partnership with the food production company ültje that contains six bonus peanut cards. ("Peanut" in German is "Erdnuss".)

The game plays as traditional Bohnanza, with players trading cards and planting beans in fields in order to score points. While normally each type of bean must stand on its own in a field, the peanut card can be played on any other type of bean. If a field is harvested with a peanut on top of it, the entire field is worthless (as the peanut thief has been caught in the act). If, however, the peanut is buried between two other beans in that field, then the field is worth one more taler than normal.

AMIGO notes that it produced 10,000 copies of this special edition.

Fall's Leaves Fall is a roll and write game about us as drafts that help Autumn leaves fall to the ground from a tree.

Pretty simple, right?

Well, the are 2 small restrictions for movement and in your way down you get to take victory points from other leaves you meet, dandelions and get bonuses from various sources, plus in your personal board you can have a set collection bonus plus a bonus if you reach down first!

All you need is to print the main board, the player board and the rules, get six dice and as many colored pencils as the number of players and start rolling and falling !!!

—description from the designer

Quintro is a simple game similar to Tic-Tac-Toe. Only instead of three in a row, the winner must connect five in a row.

This is part of a travel game edition from Spear.

bastion is a checkers variant. The player with the white tokens tries to reach all red places or to enclose the black tokens of the other player. The player with the black tokens tries to remove at least 16 white tokens from the board by jumping over them. 
The winner is the player who reaches his goal first.

This game is part of a travel game edition from Spear.
Players are travelling to Rome. On their way, they answer several questions about ancient Rome.

A card game about soccer
The starting player play a card and the next players try to find a next logical move by playing a new card. The winner is the player who managed to get rid off his cards before the others do so.

Party Game.
85 challenge and special cards, 1 die, 1 Arschkeks (Ass Cookie).
The player who has the "Arschkeks" is the active player. He draws a card and tries to do the challenge. If he is successful he gets the points which are written on the card. After his challenge he selects the next player.
If the player does not succeed he gets a punishment.
Examples for challenges:

     Call your the other players "Arschkeks" for 5 minutes.
     Hold your chair with your outstretched arm for 30 seconds.


Example for Punishments:

     Jump 1 minute on the place and say with each jump idiot
     10 knee bends


Special cards: suspend (stay in pushup positon till the next player has done his challenge), take 2 cards (draw 2 and do both), creativ card (make your own challenge for 1-3 players), joker (you may ignore 1 punishment, if you don't want to do a challenge)

Criss-cross the USA in a race to obtain a million miles!

Fasten your seatbelt and prepare for takeoff, as you are about to embark on a sprint to a million miles! The skies ahead are turbulent and unpredictable. Bad weather, traffic delays and disgruntled passengers will all conspire against you as you and your fellow competitors criss-cross the country in a race to determine who will be crowned the Million Mile Flyer.

Along the way you will have the opportunity to impede your opponents progress, but keep in mind what ever misfortune you visit on others will likely be returned. But that's all part of the fun. The game is unpredictable and your circumstances can literally change in the blink of an eye.

Frequent travelers will find themselves reliving their own air travel nightmares in a humorous setting while kids will love the nonstop, action packed race to the finish line.

—descriptoion from the designer

Sit down and grab a glass because here comes a story...

You've plundered the dungeon and come away with a solid and heavy treasure chest. After struggling to break the lock, to everyone's surprise, the chest was full of...potions! In Brewitched, you are adventurers sharing and tasting unknown potions to discover which ones are the most powerful (and valuable).

Spend your action points to smell, switch, drink, and throw away a potion or use one of the eight characters' special abilities. But be careful! Some of the potions are cursed, and this curse will be represented in real life... The results will be hilarious!

A DRINKING GAME (OR NOT)
Fun with or without drinks!
Play with younger players or designated drivers.

Mine Carts is a game in which the players together explore an abandoned mine, looking for precious ores!

The abandoned mine is represented by a six by six grid on a board. The players start with two player figures each at the edges and take turns placing square tiles with tracks leading into the mine. They follow the tracks and may stumble upon ore deposits when doing so. Mining an ore deposit yields an ore token that may be more or less valuable.

Throughout the game, players will find themselves colliding with other players. Players that collide will loose their player figures and will, when no player figures remain, be eliminated from the game. However, eliminated players haven't automatically lost the game. They may still win, granted that they managed to collect the most precious ores before being eliminated!

Clever players may find ways to mine the ore deposits while also eliminating other players!

—description from the designer

Interference! is a game in which two players attempt to save the world from utter destruction.

You are the operators of a missile control mainframe and due to a slight human error, the total annihilation of the world is looming! The systems have locked you out and you can only rely on your hacking skills to regain control.

The mainframe's lock is represented by four double-sided cards that are shared between the two players. Both players hold a hand of secret action cards as well as a card showing a secret target sequence.

Using their action cards, the players struggle to change the lock sequence into their target sequence. This will break a layer of the mainframe's security system and help the players regain control.

Will the two players prevail and save the world or should we all seek immediate shelter? The fate of the world is in your hands!

—description from the designer

The elements have become misaligned and are causing all sorts of trouble in the world. Severe drought, hurricane after hurricane and yet another super hero movie that no one asked for are just some of the plagues the world has had to live through. In Prima Materia, the players struggle to align the elements in an effort to make all things good again.

The elements are represented by sixteen double-sided cards showing one of the four classical elements on each side. These cards are arranged in a grid of four by four cards. Each player holds a secret hand of action cards as well as a card with a secret target sequence. The players use their action cards to change the elemental cards and gain points for each sequence they manage to form.

Will the elements realign and introduce stability in the world? Or will we face a future of starvation, war and reggaeton music?

—description from the designer

In Homebrew: The Potion Brewing Game, the players venture down into the haunted basement of their house. The players are attempting to brew magic potions and need to find the correct ingredients, but someone has left the basement in a terrible mess!

In every room of the basement, one of six different magic ingredients is to be found. The players each hold secret recipe cards and take turns exploring the basement by placing new rooms next to the existing ones.

When a player manages to find the ingredients required to brew their special magic potion, they gain a point. The player having brewed the most potions when the basement is fully explored becomes the potion master and wins the game!

—description from the designer

Making sweet combinations can be such a blast! In Sugar Blast, you try to make connections between same-colored candies to create blasts! You must swap out two adjacent candies to make a string of three or more of the same type. Then, you remove the matched candies and adjust the unique tilting board so that candies slide down to fill in the missing spaces. Finally, you fill in candies at the top from ones chosen randomly from the bag. The bigger the blast you create, the more candies you earn.

You are going to try to make big moves, but must be careful not to leave valuable opportunities for your opponents. Everyone is in a race to collect candies and complete the objective card. The first one to collect the necessary candies will earn a sweet victory!

—description from the publisher

"Egemonia" simulates the Peloponnesian War between Sparta and Athens in ancient Greece. Each player represent one of these two important cities and will try to orientate as much areas as possible to its side. 
The focus is on influence rather than on real wargaming.
In Vertical, you play a mountaineer on an evolving, demanding cliff face, competing against ruthless competitors to climb, which will be a problem since you've forgotten some of your equipment...
The Parisian metro is a true labyrinth. In Metro, you must assemble your metro line and be the first to reach your destination, taking as few connections as possible.

ã²ã©ã‚‰ã®ã—ã‚‡ã†ã‚‚ã†ã›ã‚“ (Hitora no Shousen) Hydra's War of Attrition is a Japanese 2 player abstract game with a horror theme.

Translated from the rules
"There are small hydras which inhabit a dangerous land full of evil spirits. They sluggishly move back and forth, sometimes running across one another. When that happens, they battle to the death."

User description
Each player places a trio of hydra tokens (Majoritei, Arakure, and Fushigi) on marked spaces along the edge of the board.  A turn then consists of the following steps: Multiplying the Majoritei, moving a hydra, and possibly removing opposing hydra pieces.

Players start by taking a Majoritei hydra from their supply and placing it next to another one already on the board. They then choose one of their hydra to move. Finally, if they've surrounded an opponent's hydra and at least one of their surrounding hyrda is on a nest of evil spirits, they capture their opponent's piece and return their piece from the nest to their supply.

These steps are repeated until one player can either form a line using six of their hydra, or until all of a player's hydra are captured.

In Race to Space, players embark on an epic battle of wits earning points and game advantages by completing mission quests. Avoid treacherous sabotages, swaps, steals and other shenanigans while navigating through mini games such as Rock-Paper-Scissors duels, instant win chances, and dice challenges. Blast off with this Space Age game designed to re-define learning as an out of this world experience! Finally, a game for kids who wish learning was fun!

Ojczysty ("Native") is a party game in which Polish language will surprise you with its wealth. More than hundred unusual words. Their meanings are explained on the cards. One of the six words on the board will be your hidden goal. Your task is to guess it with the help of clue cards provided by another player. Will you risk betting only one answer...?
 
The game was published as part of the social and educational campaign "Native - add to favorites", run by the National Center for Culture since 2012. Its aim is to shape the linguistic awareness of Poles and to promote care for the correctness of the Polish language.

—description from the designer

DisgRace To The White House is a fast-paced, strategic, and satirical board game for energized progressives everywhere. In between protesting, marching, and crying into your pillow--why not laugh too? DisgRace To The White House provides catharsis and the roadmap to resistance during these trying, rights-depleted, tiny-hands times. Players brush up on America's horribly archaic Electoral College system as well as DJT's certifiably insane Tweets, as they navigate the election in a race to the White House.

While battling for electoral votes, players impersonate Trump's "unique" form of verbal diarrhea, quote mind-bending Tweets, and pick up "Disaster" Cards, all in the name of winning the oval office through alternative facts. Interactive, team-building and generally outrageous, players shriek, squeal, and laugh--all at the same time. Gameplay constantly shifts until a winner is crowned (poor choice of words). You're never assured of victory until the bitter end (sorry "Haters and Losers!"). A perfect gift--play it around the trashcan fire when the Trumpocalypse finally comes!

—description from the designers

The goal of Takla sounds simple: Place wooden blocks to create a structure that touches the red ball in the center of the playing area.

The challenge, though, comes from where you start building and where the ball is located. The ball is on a column, and you can place it as high or as low as you want, with more height equalling a greater challenge. Each of the 2-4 players starts building at a certain mark away from the column, although you could handicap some players by starting them further back. You need to stack the wooden blocks to create a floating one-ended bridge, a bridge that reaches out toward the ball and ideally doesn't collapse under its own weight or unbalanced nature.

You can play a real-time game in which whoever touches the ball first wins, a pauper's game in which whoever uses the fewest pieces wins, or a turn-based game in which players place blocks one by one.

Mechanisms is a game of mechanisms.

To play, deal each player 3 Mechanism Cards and place the included hodgepodge of components within reach of everyone on a table. The first clue-giver is the person who most recently posted a comment on BoardGameGeek.

Starting with the first clue-giver, then clockwise, each clue-giver has 30 seconds to silently use the components on the table (as well as fellow players) as props to get someone to guess 2 of their Mechanism Cards. Clue-givers are encouraged to pair the mechanisms in a set of seemingly seamless actions as if they were playing a game with all mechanisms present. The guesser(s) gets the correctly guessed Mechanism Card as a point and the clue-giver gets the third Mechanism Card as a point if 2 mechanisms are guessed.

After everyone has had a turn, shuffle all non-point Mechanism cards and deal 2 new Mechanism cards to each player, continuing the game.

The player who collects 5 Mechanisms first this way, wins! As a finale, feel free to pitch a fun, creative, and unique game idea using all of your mechanism point cards!

—description from the designer

Magnio consists of unique and mesmerizing pieces that push, pull and shoot on each other - with the power of magnetism. Similar to a deck of cards, you’re not limited to a single game. You'll find several fun and attractive games in the box, but you will soon find yourself experimenting and playing with the pieces freehand. Now you'll be able to create your very own games, expanding the possibility of Magnio even further!

Magnetic air-hockey? No problem!

Magnetic curling? Create it!

It's a game designed for those that desire to think outside the box, or just want to casually play some magnetic dexterity action!

You're invited to explore the possibilities with hands-on demonstrations of physics and fun. Push, pull, and shoot magnets with other magnets as you manipulate the set. Create structures and sculptures, test your skills, create new games, and find even more ways to play. However you decide to use them, we're positive you'll enjoy the experience of Magination.

Minicity, the funnest game to learn English with friends. Explore this coloring and exciting city full of surprises!

It consists of a colorful and vibrant circular board where you can move from the launch of a dice. Players start at the Bank, then passing through different places and stores in the miniature city. They can buy all the places and adding workers and products related to every place or shop. And all in English!

Every time players stop at the social media icons, they receive “social media messages” through the messages cards and get ready for different surprises and actions to do at MiniCity. They can be lucky, or not so much!

Players can role play to “work” as a bank teller or a realtor while playing. Also, they can use Minicity cars and taxi, if getting some of the lucky messages.

The player with the most places and most money at the end of the game will be the winner.

The forgotten creatures of the forest have awoken from their slumber and nobody knows for sure what is lurking in the Iron Valley. You followed the call of your king. Now it is time for heroic deeds in The Boldest!


Defeat mechanical monsters, retrieve enigmatic artifacts, use helpful items and lead your faction to glory. Each round, three expedition leave into the unknown to explore this mysterious place. You form three groups, one for each expedition, with the heroes in your hand. Only the strongest groups can take part in an expedition, so you need to apportion your power. Can you read your opponents well enough and forestall them? Collect the most experience and become a legend! Are you worthy of the title “The Boldest”?

 
Max Prentis passionately created and illustrated the world of The Boldest. His love for details can be found on every card. The over 100 unique Illustrations let you delve into this rich world. Get ready to explore!
 Those of you who are curious and want a glimpse at the game mechanics are in luck because we want to give you a peak under the hood for the new, second game by Sophia Wagner (Noria was her first).
 The core mechanics of The Boldest are Hand Management, Programming and Hidden Bidding. 
Each player starts with a Faction consisting of 17 Starting Heroes from the 5 Classes (3 Warriors, 3 Technicians, 3 Hunters, 5 Cooks and 3 Pets).
 In the Planning Phase you secretly form three Groups with Heroes of the same Class behind your Screen and place them face down one Group per Planning Space.
Every Hero executes a different Action in the following Action Phase but in general they let you take specific Forest Cards or new Heroes. 
Pets are the only exception they can be combined with any other Class. Why is that important?
 Because in the Action Phase only the strongest Groups can execute their Classes action. 
The Planning Spaces are resolved consecutively. First all players reveal their Group in Planning Space 1 and tell the other players the Class they played and the Group Strength (defined by the number of Class icons on the played cards). The strongest Group executes their action and afterwards sends their Leader to the king (this Hero is out of the game) while the remaining Heroes celebrate their success in the Party Tent. 
They won’t be available next round to that player. Weaker Groups keep their Heroes and get a new one as compensation.

As mentioned before, the Classes execute different Actions in a specific order: Warriors always go first followed by Technicians, Hunters and Cooks. The Cooks convince new Heroes with Special Abilities to join your Faction with their delicious dishes. The Warriors, Technicians and Hunters can take specific Forest Cards while other cards block their way. How the Forest changes over the course of three Expeditions of a round is also something you must anticipate during the Planning Phase. In the Action Phase you cannot change your Groups anymore.

After 5 or 6 rounds (depending on the number of players) the player who was able to collect the most experience will be known as "The Boldest"!

—description from the publisher

Don't let this little box fool you...it's stuffed with tons of interesting trivia questions that'll have you thinking, laughing, and wracking your brains!

Put on your smarty pants and have a ball!  Play for hours & collect 'em all!

This cute little box contains a game board, 4 pawns, a die, 500 questions on cards, rules, and unquantifiable fun.  Seriously.

—description from the box

A collection of 50 drinking games broken into six different categories: active, drinking, improv, team, word and stupid. Some games are old standards (but with a new twist), while others are little known. Whether it be a pregame, vision quest or full-blown mass cult suicide - there's a game here to suit every get-together!

From the creators of the game, "DRUNK STONED OR STUPID," games are customizable to play with or without drinking.

Don't let this little box fool you...it's stuffed with tons of interesting trivia questions that'll have you thinking, laughing, and wracking your brains!

Put on your smarty pants and have a ball!  Play for hours & collect 'em all!  Juicy little tidbits of useless knowledge!

This cute little box contains a game board, 4 pawns, a die, 500 questions on cards, rules, and unquantifiable fun.  Seriously.

—description from the box

Help the Critters find all the hidden objects to decorate the house before the guest of honor arrives.  The 3-dimensional game board features 4 Calico Critter rooms.

As you travel the game board with your Critter, you'll look for the 5 things which belong in your room.  You'll need a good memory and a bit of luck to succeed.  If you get your room totally decorated first, before your opponents' AND before the birthday girl arrives--Surprise! You win!

—description from the publisher
